net.sf.JRecord.def.IO.builders

Interface Icb2xmlIOBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Icb2xmlLoadOptions, IIOBuilder, INewLineCreator, ISchemaIOBuilder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Icb2xmlMultiFileIOBuilder

    public interface Icb2xmlIOBuilder
extends IIOBuilder, Icb2xmlLoadOptions
    These classes will create Cobol Record Readers/Writers using the supplied COBOL copybook 
    Example:
 
      AbstractLineReader r = JRecordInterface1.COBOL
              .newIOBuilder("file-name")
                  .setFileOrganization(Constants.IO_FIXED_LENGTH)
                  .setDialect(ICopybookDialects.FMT_FUJITSU)
              .newReader("Data-Filename");
    Main Methods:
    • setFileOrganization Set the file organization (or Structure). While a Windows/Unix style file organization is the most common (supported by Constants.IO_STANDARD_TEXT_FILE or Constants.IO_UNICODE_TEXT in JRecord). There others including (but is not limited to): 
           Variable Length where the length is before the Record Data:
     
           <Record-LengthFixed-Sized-record-Data<record-Data><Record-Length><record-Data><Record-Length><record-Data>
           
     Fixed-Length where all records a of a constant fixed Length:
     
          <Fixed-Sized-record-Data><Fixed-Sized-record-Data><Fixed-Sized-record-Data>
          
     CSV files with \n embedded in Quotes is another variation
    • setSplitCopybook Wether the Cobol-Copybook should be split into sub-record's or not and how it should be split.
    • setDialectsetCopybookFileFormat - is a standard Column 6-72 or some other format
    • setFont Set the font (character-set) used in the Data-File.
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

    • Method Detail

      • setFileOrganization

        Icb2xmlIOBuilder setFileOrganization(int fileOrganization)
        Description copied from interface: IIOBuilder
        File Organization or File Structure (e.g. VB, Fixed Width Etc. Use Constants.IO_* The main options are:
        • Constants.IO_DEFAULT - JRecord will decide the actual method based on other values (The Default Value). It is generally better to explicitly set the File-Organisation (or file-Structure).
        • Constants.IO_STANDARD_TEXT_FILE - Standard Windows/*nix/Mac text file using \n, \n\r etc as a record (or line) delimiter.
        • Constants.IO_UNICODE_TEXT - Standard Windows/*nix/Mac Unicode / double byte text file using \n, \n\r etc as a record (or line) delimiter. It ensures record are stored in character format (instead of bytes).
        • Constants.IO_FIXED_LENGTH - Every Record (or line) is a standard Fixed length based on the Maximum schema length.
        • Constants.IO_FIXED_LENGTH_CHAR - Fixed length character file (typically used for Fixed-Length unicode files).
        • Constants.IO_VB - Mainframe VB (Variable Record length file). Records consist of a Record-Length followed by the Record-Data.
        • Constants.IO_VB_DUMP - Raw Block format of a Mainframe-VB file. You get this format if you specify RECFM=U when reading it on the mainframe.
        • Constants.IO_VB_GNU_COBOL - GNU (open-Cobol) VB format.
        Specified by:
        setFileOrganization in interface IIOBuilder
        Parameters:
        fileOrganization - File Organization (or File Structure)

      • setSplitCopybook

        Icb2xmlIOBuilder setSplitCopybook(int splitCopybook)
        Specified by:
        setSplitCopybook in interface Icb2xmlLoadOptions
        Parameters:
        splitCopybook - Wether to Split the Copybook or not. Options are:
        • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_NONE - No Split
        • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_REDEFINE - Split on highest-Level redefines
        • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_01_LEVEL - Split on 01 levels
        • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_HIGHEST_REPEATING - Split on the highest group level in the copybook.

        Most of the time it does not matter what this parameter is set to, exceptions include copybook where there are multiple-records at a group level > 01 (use SPLIT_HIGHEST_REPEATING): 

         
         05  Header-Record.
             ....
         05  Detail-Record.
             ....
         05  Trailer-Record.
             ....
      • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_NONE where Records are redefined: 
              01 Input-Record.
         05 Field-1                 pic x(..).
         05 Field-2                 pic s9(4) comp.
           ...
         05 Field-n                 pic x(..).
      • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_REDEFINE for simple single record copybooks 
          
   01  Output-Record.
       05 Common-Record-Header.
          10 Record-type
             ...
       05 Record-1.
          .....
       05 Record-2 redefines Record-1.
          .....
       05 Record-3 redefines Record-1.
          .....
      • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_01_LEVEL where Records are redefined:
        01 Record-1. 05 Record-Type .... 01 Record-2. 05 Record-Type .... 01 Record-2. 05 Record-Type ....
      • CopybookLoader.SPLIT_HIGHEST_REPEATING where Records are redefined: 
         
         05  Header-Record.
             ....
         05  Detail-Record.
             ....
         05  Trailer-Record.
             ....

    • setFont

      Description copied from interface: IIOBuilder

      Parameters:

    • setRecordSelection

      Icb2xmlIOBuilder setRecordSelection(java.lang.String recordName,
                                  net.sf.JRecord.ExternalRecordSelection.ExternalSelection selectionCriteria)
      Description copied from interface: Icb2xmlLoadOptions
      Define record-selection criteria. For a single selection you would do
      Specified by:
      setRecordSelection in interface Icb2xmlLoadOptions
      Parameters:
      recordName - name of the record
      selectionCriteria - selection-criteria. Typically you would use new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type", "D") or similar
      Returns:
      updated IOBuilder 
       Usage:
 
   IOBldr.setRecordSelection("Header-Record", new FieldSelection("Record-Type", "H"));
      or if you want to use or's / and's 
        
   IOBldr.setRecordSelection(
          "Trailer-Record",
          ExternalGroupSelection.newOr(
                  new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type", "D"),
                  new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type", "E"),
                  new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type", "F")
         ));
 
 This is basically the following expression:
    
         Record-Type = "D"
      or Record-Type = "E"
      or Record-Type = "F"
      
 and more complicated boolean logic is possible:
 
 
         IOBldr.setRecordSelection(
          "Trailer-Record",
          ExternalGroupSelection.newAnd(
               new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-1", "D"),
               ExternalGroupSelection.newOr(
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "D"),
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "E"),
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "F")
               )
          ));
          
   which is
   
             Record-Type-1 = "D"
       and ( Record-Type-2 = "D"
          or Record-Type-2 = "E"
          or Record-Type-2 = "F" )     
          
      * and more complicated boolean logic is possible:
 
 
         IOBldr.setRecordSelection(
          "Trailer-Record",
          ExternalGroupSelection.newAnd(
               new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-1", "D"),
               ExternalGroupSelection.newOr(
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "D"),
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "E"),
                    new ExternalFieldSelection("Record-Type-2", "F")
               )
          ));
          
   which is
   
             Record-Type-1 = "D"
       and ( Record-Type-2 = "D"
          or Record-Type-2 = "E"
          or Record-Type-2 = "F" )

    • setRecordDecider

      Icb2xmlIOBuilder setRecordDecider(RecordDecider recordDecider)
      Description copied from interface: Icb2xmlLoadOptions
      Cobol Copybooks do not define how to determine which record is which in a way that a package like JRecord can determine. In some cases JRecord needs to know which record is which. You can use a RecordDecider to tell JRecord which record to use. 
            05  Record-Type                 pic x.
          88 Header-Record-Type    'H'.
          88 Detail-record-Type    'D'.
           ...  
      05  Header-Record.
      
      05  Detail-Record redefines Header-Record.
      And in JRecord 
           RecordDecider rd = JRecordInterface1.RECORD_DECIDER_BUILDER
                              .singleFieldDeciderBuilder("Record-Type", true)
                                  .addRecord("H", "Header-Record")
                                  .addRecord("D", "Detail-Record")
                              .build();
     ioBuilder
             .setRecordDecider(rd) ...
      Specified by:
      setRecordDecider in interface Icb2xmlLoadOptions
      Parameters:
      recordDecider - a Record-Decider to be used
      Returns:
      this IOBuilder for future updates

    • setLog

      Old parameter, can be ignore most of the time
      Parameters:
      log - the log to set

    • setDropCopybookNameFromFields

      Icb2xmlIOBuilder setDropCopybookNameFromFields(boolean dropCopybookNameFromFields)
      whether to drop the copybook name from the start of the Field names. On the mainframe it is quite common to start (or end) a field name with the copybook name. This parameter controls wether the this copybook name should be dropped or kept in JRecord. 
       for copybook DTAR030:
 
     05 DTAR030.
        10 DTAR030-Product-Code            pic 9(8).
        10 DTAR030-Location                pic 9(4).
        05 DTAR030-Quantity                pic s9(6) comp-3.
        
  this option lets you remove/keep the copybook name at the start of the field name.
      Specified by:
      setDropCopybookNameFromFields in interface Icb2xmlLoadOptions
      Parameters:
      dropCopybookNameFromFields - drop the copybook name from the start of the Field names ? In the above example if
      • true - DTAR030-Product-Code is converted to Product-Code.
      • false - DTAR030-Product-Code remains unchanged.

      Note: The default is false

    • setKeepFillers

      Icb2xmlIOBuilder setKeepFillers(boolean keepFillers)
      Deprecated. While you can use this option, I suggest you try and avoid it (i.e. name the filler fields).
      Controls wether fillers are kept in the layout.
      Parameters:
      keepFillers - keep fillers in the layout
      Returns:
      this for further updates
